availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Hunter (Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Ann Church Hunter in Henderson County, Kentucky, on March 7, 1848. Father of Mary J. Hunter, Susan A. Hunter, William T. Hunter, Ann E. Hunter, George W. Hunter, Harvey Hunter, and Iley Hunter. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Henderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 327B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 2, p. 163A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Cairo Precinct, p. 5B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film 000576460.
"George Washington Hunter (1815-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial 42540157, accessed October 25, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/42540157.
